text: Jefferson County is a county found in the U.S. state of Montana. As of the 2020 United States Census, there were 12,085 people. Its county seat is Boulder. The county was created in 1865 and named after Thomas Jefferson, the 3rd President of the United States (1801â€“1809). == References == Category:1865 establishments in Montana Territory Category:Montana counties
title: Jefferson County, Montana
